pros:
A lot of responsibility early on which encourages growth
Meaningful work - you're motivated to work hard
Open plan office and encouragement to ask questions and talk with other coworkers outside your department
Varied work if you ask for it
Remote working (at least during lockdown)
Opportunities to work with outside stakeholders
Looks very good on your CV
cons:
The salary of 1000USD per month is prohibitively low, many bright people will not be able to afford to work here.
The work can be traumatising and the prevailing opinion is that you will just need to get over it
Vast amount of work can be overwhelming - balancing casework with policy can be hard.
Hard to advocate for vulnerable people due to many conflicting priorities
Management is very disjointed, unclear who your hierarchical superior is, time wasted due to supervisors' thinly veiled disdain for each other, conflicting work styles and lack of communication.

pros: base salary high, some travel opps
